result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley L Hawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked, only after serving 50% of the confinement time.
Consecutive to: 21CF623 if revoked.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent to include individual counseling on anger management.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley L Hawley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Ashley L Hawley. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. Upon plea to 21CF623, Ct. 1, Ct. 3 and Ct. 5 the State would recommend 18 mo IC and 18 mo. ES on Ct. 1 i/s, 2 yr. probation, 60 days RCJ on Ct. 3, i/s, 2 yr. prob. 30 days RCJ, i/s, 2 yr. probation, consecutive to Ct. 1 if revoked.   22CF761, plea to Ct. 2 the State would recommend 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES, i/s, 2 yr. prob. Consecutive to 21CF623 if revoked.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters her plea.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  There is a restitution request in the amount of Defendant speaks on her own behalf. 
Plea:
21CF623:
Ct. 1- GUILTY
Ct. 3- GUILTY
Ct. 5- GUILTY

22CF761:
Ct. 2- GUILTY

BTC:
21CF1516- DRI
21CF846- DRI
21CF1164- DRI

21CF623:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, 4 yr. WPS, 2 yr. IC and 2 yr. ES, i/s, 2 1/2 years probation.
Ct. 3- GUILTY, 60 days RCJ, i/s, 2 yr. probation.  Consecutive to Ct. 1 if revoked. 
Ct. 5- GUILTY, 30 days RCJ, i/s, 2 yr. probation. Consecutive to Cts. 1 and 3 if revoked. 
ALL REMAINING COUNTS DRI.

22CF761:
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 3 yr. WPS, 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES, i/s, 2 years probation.
Consecutive to 21CF623 if revoked. 
ALL REMAINING COUNTS DRI.


Conditions:
90 days RCJ on 21CF623, STAYED.
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA  assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.
Do not socialize with known drug users or dealers. 
Individual counseling for anger management. 
Obtain and Maintain full time employment.
Restitution $302.40 City and Villages Mutual Ins. Co. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.
Eligible for CIP and SAP if revoked, only after serving 50% of the confinement time.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley L Hawley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Ashley L Hawley. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
